medical_history.chief_complaint: New diffuse bilateral microcalcifications in the breast ducts detected 5 weeks after completing lactation.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient, a 33-year-old woman, noted a thickening in the upper outer quadrant of her left breast after one month of breastfeeding. Physical examination revealed multiple, palpable breast nodules. She experienced bilateral obstructed milk ducts that recurred weekly for 11 months, resolving with hot compresses and continued breastfeeding.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient has a strong family history of breast cancer, with her mother and maternal grandmother diagnosed with unilateral breast cancer at ages 39 and 46, respectively. She had a baseline mammogram at age 30 that showed dense breast tissue but no malignancy or calcifications. She had an uncomplicated pregnancy and breastfed for one year. A single episode of acute mastitis was treated successfully.
medical_history.family_history: The patient's mother and maternal grandmother both had unilateral breast cancer at ages 39 and 46, respectively.
